results.title: Life of a primitive people: Africa
results.brief_description: Shows the characteristics of a primitive society, and the interventions and discoveries made by man in prehistoric times. Clarifies the meaning of ‘primitive’ by showing the pattern of life in uncivilized regions of Africa. Shows activities such as weaving and pottery-making embodying thought and skill without technology.

results.title: Life of a Philippine family
results.brief_description: An account of family life in a rural area of the Philippines. The family is that of Carlos, a rice farmer, his wife and two children. Observes Carlos at work in his rice field, his wife shopping and preparing meals for the family, the children as they go to school and assist their parents.

results.title: Life Minus 3
results.brief_description: A film for the layperson on emergency procedures should someone have a sudden heart attack. If the heart stops beating, brain cells will die after three minutes. During this three minute period it is vital that life be prolonged by heart-lung and mouth to mouth resuscitation until expert aid arrives.

results.title: Life is sweet
results.creator_credit: Film Four International, British Screen, Thin Man Films, Simon Channing-Williams and Mike Leigh
results.brief_description: Mike Leigh’s comedy about one working lower-class English family is an affectionate, bittersweet and compassionate portrait, in the tradition of the kitchen-sink drama. By using extensive improvisation, Leigh encourages his actors to develop their own sense of characterisation. This produces a thoroughly convincing rendering of a family subtly at war with each other whilst trying to sort out their private concerns. Andrew, a chronic procrastinator and small-time dreamer is happily married to Wendy, an eternally sunny woman. They live with their twin daughters Natalie, a plumber with a simple outlook on life, and Nicola, an ill-tempered misanthrope who nurses a secret eating disorder. When not bickering, the girls share mutual contempt for their parents, who they regard as quite batty. Into this colourful mix is Patsy, a somewhat hopeless family friend who talks Andrew into hare-brained schemes and Aubrey, a deluded owner of a French-themed cafe who provides numerous laughs with his repulsive menu and lascivious manner. Leigh’s protagonists are full of nuance, extremely endearing and quite credible. Despite the weighty subject matter that he mines, Leigh maintains a whimsical tone, whilst slowly revealing the frustrations and setbacks that fester under the daily grind. Cast includes Alison Steadman, Jim Broadbent, Claire Skinner, Jane Horrocks, Stephen Rea, Timothy Spall, David Thewlis.

results.title: Life is short
results.creator_credit: United Nations, Unesco and Stephen Hearst
results.brief_description: Contrasts the surplus in rich lands, with the chronic malnutritian and near-starvation in the poor. Relates U.N. family efforts to assure a basic and healthy diet for all; and the problem of production, distribution and social adjustment involved; the “Freedom from Hunger” campaign. U Thant tells of the urgency and the target involved in the U. N.’s Development Decade.

results.title: Life is for living
results.creator_credit: Filmpartnership and Guide Dog Association of Victoria
results.brief_description: Blindness is not such a great problem when you learn to overcome it. Some of the ways to do this are through the use of guide dogs, canes or sonic guides; other senses must be utilised to the full. The film also shows blind people leading normal lives and makes suggestions for fund raising.

results.title: Life is beautiful = La vita e bella
results.creator_credit: Melampo Cinematografica, Elda Ferri, Gianluigi Braschi and Roberto Benigni
results.brief_description: In this World War II tragicomedy, writer/director Roberto Benigni portrays Guido, who moves during the 30s from the country to a Tuscan town, where he falls in love with schoolteacher Dora. Dora likes Guido, but she remains faithful to her pompous fiancee, causing Guido to come up with inventive ways of wooing her. Meanwhile, anti-semitic attitudes lead to attacks against Jewish members of the community, including Guido’s uncle. Leaping ahead five years, during World War II, Guido and Dora are married with a son Giosue. After they are imprisoned in a concentration camp, Guido goes to elaborate lengths to keep his son from understanding the truth of their situation. In Italian with English subtitles. Cast includes: Roberto Benigni, Nicoletta Braschi, Giustino Durano and Giorgio Cantarini.

results.title: Life is a long quiet river = La Vie est une long fleuve tranquille
results.creator_credit: Telema, M2, F3Films, Charles Gassot, Louis Becker and Etienne Chatiliez
results.brief_description: The Groseilles and the Le Quesnoys are two French families who, under normal circumstances would never meet. The Groseilles are hedonist working class, seizing on every opportunity to make money and have fun. The Le Quesnoys are aristocratic pillars of the community. A vengeful nurse swapped their babies at birth and, after many years, she reveals the secret. A satirical comedy which won four French Academy Awards, including Best Director. In French with English subtitles.
